intro: Macrorhamnus faraloatra, commonly known as the Madagascar mallow, is a flowering plant native to Madagascar. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes cotton and hibiscus. The plant is characterized by its large, palmate leaves and showy, pinkish-white flowers. It typically grows in moist, shaded habitats within the rainforests of Madagascar. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
